Detailed Description

Writes log files.

Returns:
true if the logfiles are currently open and can be written to

Never throws

no files are open

void newFiles ( const Serializable::ObjectIDVec &  ids_to_log,
const std::string &  logging_dir,
const std::string &  suffix = "",
int  file_buffer_size = 32768 
)

Open some new logfiles for writing.

Parameters:
ids_to_log Vector of object IDs that we want to log. Each ID in this vector will have its own logfile that objects with a corresponding ID will be written to
logging_dir The directory to create the new logfiles in
suffix A string that will be appended to the log file filename, before the file extension. This can be used to append a date and time to the logfile, for example.
file_buffer_size Buffer file size.
Precondition:
no files are open
Exceptions:
EngineOutputDataFileError if an error occured in opening the files
See also:
objectIDToFileName
Deprecated:
Use newFile().

logging_dir The directory to create the new logfiles in

static std::wstring objectIDToFileName ( Serializable::ObjectID  object_id  )  [static]

Map between a Serializable object ID and a filename.

Returns:
the filename that represents the data specified by object_id. For example "Head" for HeadOutputData objects.
Exceptions:
EngineOutputDataFileError If the ID is unrecognised
The default mappings are:
  • TimingOutputData "Timing"
  • HeadOutputData "Head"
  • HeadOutputDataV2 "HeadV2"
  • EyeOutputData "Eye"
  • FeatureSetsByCamera "Features"
  • FaceOutputData "Face"
  • FaceOutputDataV2 "FaceV2"
  • WorldOutputData "World"
  • WorldOutputDataV2 "WorldV2"
  • EngineStateOutputData "EngineState"
  • InertiaOutputData "Inertia"
  • CustomEventOutputData "Custom_Events"
  • GPSOutputData "GPS"
  • GPSOutputDataV2 "GPSV2"

static void registerObjectIDFileName ( Serializable::ObjectID  object_id,
std::wstring  filename 
) [static]

Registers a mapping between a Serializable object ID and a filename.

void writeData ( const ConstEngineOutputDataPtr &  data  ) 

Write data to the open logfiles.

Each top-level sub object that has serializeEnabled() == true and corresponds to an open logfile is extracted from data and written to file. Nothing is done if data->serializeEnabled() == false. If the top-level sub object is not found it is also looked for under the first FaceSetOutputDataLatest object.

Parameters:
data The engine output data to write to files.
Precondition:
files are open
Exceptions:
EngineOutputDataFileError Failed to write file.
Deprecated:
Use non-shared pointer version.
